Detailed Description

Module for dealing with low-level data.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum chaos::data::Endianness

The possible endian types.

Enumerator
ENDIAN_BIG 

The least-significant byte is stored at the highest memory address.

ENDIAN_LITTLE 

The least-significant byte is stored at the lowest memory address.

Function Documentation

chaos::uint32 chaos::data::bytes_to_uint32 ( const void *  bytes,
std::size_t  length,
Endianness  endianness = chaos::data::get_system_endianness() 
)

Converts an array of bytes to a single unsigned 32-bit integer.

Parameters
bytesArray of bytes to convert.
lengthThe number of bytes in the data array provided.
endiannessThe endianness to use for the result chaos::uint32.

Example usage:

const unsigned char data[ 4 ] = { 0xAE, 0x72, 0x8B, 0x10 };
chaos::data::bytes_to_uint32( data, 4 ); // returns 2926742288
Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the length parameter is greater than `sizeof( chaos::uint32 ) (4). Since data loss will occur attempting to pack more than 4 bytes in to a 32-bit integer.`
